revised_title: Singular Points and Lines in the Theory of Loci of Ultimate Intersections of Surfaces
tldr: The author investigates the singular points and lines that occur in the theory of the locus of ultimate intersections of a system of surfaces. They extend the results from previous work on plane curves to surfaces, considering rational and integral equations of coordinates and parameters. The author identifies various types of singular points and lines, such as conic nodes, binodal lines, and unodal lines, and explains how they are connected to the discriminant of the system.
